header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 84, Volume XII-3
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Black Magic

central_thesis: The Temple of Set offers a unique and superior philosophical "lens" for perceiving and understanding reality and magical phenomena, emphasizing rigorous critical evaluation and practical application of magical principles, as exemplified by its analysis of complex magical systems like Haitian zombification.

structure_content.summary: Details the history and function of the Temple of Set's highest executive agency, the Council of Nine. It describes its origin from the "Nine Unknown Men" legend, its establishment as the corporate board of directors, and its role in supervising the High Priest and Executive Director, approving degrees, and serving 9-year terms with a rotating chairman. Current members are listed.

A devotional or invocatory poem addressed to "Nepthys," portraying her as a powerful, alluring, and transformative goddess, connected to the "Eye of the Sun," "Ophidian heat," and the "kiss of Set." It describes a mystical union or experience with the deity.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Lens of the Temple of Set
structure_content.summary: An essay by Michael A. Aquino VI° arguing that the Temple of Set provides the most effective "lens" for understanding existence. It critiques "undigested" information and superficial belief systems prevalent in mainstream occultism and philosophy. Aquino asserts that the Temple of Set, building on the Church of Satan's role in destroying self-deceit, utilizes a rigorous, Hegelian dialectic to critically evaluate preceding philosophies, offering a clearer, more powerful means for a Setian to navigate and adjust reality through LBM/GBM.

structure_content.chapter_title: Book Review: The Serpent and the Rainbow
structure_content.summary: Robert Zoller II° reviews Wade Davis's book on Haitian zombification, providing a detailed breakdown of the Clairvius Narcisse case. The review explores the cultural (secret societies, justice system) and technical (Tetradotoxin, Datura Strommonium) aspects of zombification. It highlights how zombification functions as a socio-magical system involving chemical inducement of a death-like state, ritualized soul capture (astral zombie), and cultural conditioning to enforce slavery and social norms, emphasizing the blend of physical and magical elements in Black Magic.

key_concepts.definition: A philosophical and magical framework that enables an initiate to perceive reality with "piercing clarity" and understand the "why of it all," achieved through rigorous critical evaluation (Hegelian dialectic) of existing systems, leading to a superior understanding of human existence and the application of LBM/GBM.

The supreme executive and decision-making body of the Temple of Set, serving as its corporate board of directors, responsible for supervising the High Priest and Executive Director, approving higher degrees, and maintaining the integrity of the Temple's operations. Councillors serve nine-year terms.

A complex magical and social process in Haitian culture involving: (1) the condemnation of an individual by a secret society court for violating social norms; (2) the administration of a "coup poudre" (a chemical poison, primarily Tetradotoxin, often combined with other substances) inducing a death-like trance; (3) the disinterment of the body and magical "calling" and entrapment of the victim's soul (astral zombie); and (4) the subsequent forced administration of Datura strommonium to induce docility and amnesia, resulting in the individual becoming a mindless slave controlled by a master who holds their "astral zombie."

A magical powder containing potent chemical poisons (e.g., Tetradotoxin) used in Haitian zombification to induce a death-like trance. Within the Haitian magical worldview, it is perceived as a magical substance rather than merely a chemical agent, contributing to the "subtle engineering" of the victim's perception.

The captured soul or will of a zombified individual, believed to be entrapped in a vessel by the sorcerer following the victim's apparent death and disinterment. This retained "astral zombie" allows the zombie master to exert complete control over the slave.

A term used by Michael Aquino to describe information (especially prevalent in the post-WWII era and popular occultism) that is not systematically verified, critically evaluated, or rigorously understood, leading to superficial beliefs and confusion rather than genuine insight.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined (or exemplified) involves the rigorous application of the Temple of Set's "lens" – a method of critical, Hegelian dialectic – to understand and adjust reality. This system aims for self-transformation and mastery through clear perception. It also incorporates Greater Black Magic (GBM) principles, which, as demonstrated by the zombification analysis, involve a precise combination of chemical/physical means and subtle magical/cultural engineering to achieve specific, tangible results, such as controlling an individual's will or transforming their state of being.
tools: The 'Lens' of Setian philosophy (critical thinking, self-evaluation)
Magical principles of LBM (Lesser Black Magic) and GBM (Greater Black Magic)
Specific chemical substances ('coup poudre' containing Tetradotoxin)
rituals: Rituals for 'calling' and entrapping the soul (in zombification)
Devotional/invocatory practices (e.g., as suggested by the poem 'Igneus Nepthys, Regina Ineffabilis')

relevant_quotes.text: The magician dedicated to his work with reality and its adjustment finds himself gradually becoming skilled in perceiving life with a piercing clarity. He can, in a few words, see the why of it all.

The Temple of Set is the best lens in existence for those who wish a crystal-clear look at the phenomenon of human existence - past, present, and potential. There is nothing else remotely close to it in this area.

Anton LaVey maintained that the first job of any would-be magician is to quit kidding himself. "Self-deceit," he quoth, "is the gravest of all ‘sins'." At its best the Church of Satan was an engine for destroying self-deceit... At its best the Temple of Set is a more advanced, sophisticated, and powerful version of the same engine.

The coup poudre, on the other hand, is a magical powder in the mind of the Haitian. To Davis, as to other scientifically-oriented Americans, it is merely a chemical poison derived from animal matter. Yet in the context of zombification, a GBM operation which involves both chemical substances and subtle engineering the Haitian's perception of the powder as a magical substance rather than a mere poison is more practical and to the point.

If you have yet to take advantage of the Order system - or for that matter of the more general systems of the Temple as a whole, you are missing the whole point of the Temple of Set's initiatory system.
In my opinion this book is a must for any Black Magician.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue of The Scroll of Set is highly relevant to understanding the organizational structure, philosophical underpinnings, and practical magical perspectives of the Temple of Set in the mid-1980s. It clearly articulates the Setian emphasis on intellectual rigor and critical self-evaluation ("the lens") as central to magical advancement, positioning Setianism as distinct from broader, less disciplined occult currents. The detailed review of zombification serves as a practical case study, illustrating how the Setian "lens" can analyze complex magical phenomena by integrating anthropological, scientific, and occult insights, emphasizing the blended nature of physical and spiritual components in effective Black Magic.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is existing initiates and practitioners of the Temple of Set, providing internal updates, reinforcing core doctrines, and offering advanced perspectives on magical theory and practice. A secondary audience includes serious academic researchers and advanced practitioners of Western Esotericism and Black Magic interested in a rigorous, critical, and often unconventional approach to occult phenomena.
